resources.string: Portrait of the character that is speaking
A week, a month, a year
A bird hops down from the shrine

The Gods love you, as you love the gods. You accept their divine authority and bow to it. Your connection to them is so strong a being of pure light is formed to facilitate it.\n This being calls to you.\n What name does it call?

The divine spurn you, as you spurn them. You reject their authority and refuse to bow to it. You inherently know the right way and do not require their guidance.\nYour independent morality attracts a compatriot. It seeks to know you and follow you. Who does it seek to know?

Your connection to the holy fire, the origin of life, and all righteous authority strengthens you.
In gratitude, the sun god sends you a servant to mark your connection.
This servant asks your name.
 Whom does it seek to serve?

The great moon, the wisest and kindest of the gods, grants you some of its wisdom. Its cool white blue light envelops you, and you gain knowledge in its grace. To mark your connection, the moon god sends you a spirit which seeks to serve you. Whom does it serve?

In your quiet contemplation, serenity, strength and wisdom blossom from within. You are connected to the divine, but not dependent on them. You learn to use this strength to protect others. One of those who you protect seeks to follow in your footsteps, and you embrace them gladly. Who does it follow?

A host of angels worship beside you. Together, your connection to the gos makes you strong. You are a community, and your shared faith makes you more than that.\nA younger angel seeks to befriend and learn from you.\n Who do they seek to befriend?

You are not alone in your hatred of the gods. Their arrogance, pride, and self indulgence disgust you. Who are they to command you, or command anyone? They do not understand your experience and deserve no authority. You defeat their agents, hypocrites who proclaim morality, but in truth do whatever serves them.\n One of their victims seeks to join your crusade.\nWho do they join?

You are alone

And you are complete.

 The darkness calls to you, and you become whole.
An aspect of you takes shape, a useful servant in your designs. Who does it serve?

Your anger and hatred gives you power. The fragile chains of morality that bind you break. You look at your victims, and there is much to be destroyed. Your strength forms a demon, that seeks to serve you, a useful tool in your designs.\n What arbiter of destruction does it serve?

The whispers serve you. Secrets make you strong. Dark knowledge empowers you, as you form intrigues and plots. In a dark ritual, your wisdom and essence combine to form a willing neophyte, a useful servant for your schemes\nWhom does it serve?

You are denied Death.\nThanatos, has uses for you yet. You learn the dark secrets of souls and fate at the feet of the God of Death himself. As a token of his esteem, he forms you a servant from a piece of your old body.\nWhat does this servant call you?

There are many who seek the powers of darkness. You infiltrate their ranks, earning their secrets and powers. Together, your secret societies influence grows. A neophyte is assigned to serve you.\nWhom does it serve?
You use your strength for noble pursuits. Justice, peace and concern for others are earned from your power. One of those that you save seeks to follow in your footsteps.\nWho do they serve?

Your power grows, and your dominion grows alongside it.. During your many victories you expand your influence. Thousands seek to serve you, and you choose the most worthy of them as your successor. They alone know your true name.\n What is it?

Strength courses through your being. Molten bower surges in your blood, burning your skin. You do not shy from this power, but scream in ecstasy. You become unstoppable, and bend the world to your will.\nA spark of your great flame takes light, and seeks to further your ambition.\nWho do they serve?

Strength is not enough, you seek knowledge as well. Each is a side of the coin of power that you desire. Through great effort discipline, that power becomes yours. As you influence grows, one that would grow it further seek to join you. Who do they serve?

Power leads to money, money leads to power. The snake has bitten its tail to your benefit, and it will grow larger and larger. Only one question remains: how big can it get? Your money and power lead to influence, and your influence attracts one who would help you expand it further.\nWho do they serve?

Your search leads you to the desert sands, where followers hail your strength. Together you form a hegemon and soon all of the desert tribes follow your power. One of your followers in particular catches your notice.\n Who do they serve?

The cold embraces you, as you embrace it, but you feel not its sting. Indeed the colder it gets, the wiser you become. White-blue ice forms around you, creating a transparent throne. An icy companion seeks to serve you, and you welcome it with open arms.\nWho do they join?

You go to dark places, where few dare to tread, in pursuit of forbidden knowledge. Your search brings you to the depths, dark waters where the cursed light does not reach. A power joins you there, in the form of a wise servant.\n Whom does it serve?

Knowledge is a tool, but it is necessary and not sufficient. You gain strength as well. This split focus may seem disjoint to others, but to you it is consistent - why follow only one path to power?\nOne who agrees with this seeming contradiction joins your endeavors.\nWho does it join?

Knowledge, Intelligence, Wisdom:\nthese are your tools, and they serve you well. The waters embrace you as your natural domain. There, a scholar seeks to exchange understanding. Whom do they comprehend?
In the shallow swamp, you find deep wisdom and deeper treasure. The muck suits you, and serves your desires. A young inhabitant is drawn to you.\nWhom do they join?
A community of scholars\nascend to the clouds.\nYou join them as they join you: interconnected in both wisdom and experience. A young disciple seeks to learn from you. Whom do they learn from?

You meet your needs first, then help others. This is the root of compassion, and when taking a break from helping others, you meditate on what you have learned. A young monk joins you. Who do they join?
You gain all the wealth in the world, while the rest hunger. Your riches turn foul and rotten in your possession. You allow a servant to join you.\nWho do they serve?

You find more resources in the forest, and they make you feel safe. Your resources gain you strength and power. A recruit is drawn to you, seeking both to learn your power and gain you resources.\n Who do they follow?

You study your food and learn by planting it in the ground, plants will grow. You become a shepherd of the forest as their essence compliments your wisdom and solidarity. One seeks to join you, and aid you in your service.\n Who do they join?

You have enough, and do not seek to possess more than you need. You make a life for yourself in the forest as a druid. You meet a small hungry injured dog. After rescuing it, and nursing it back to health, it becomes your constant companion.\nWho does it join?

You find a community with a herd of wild horses. To your amazement, they have wings. After sharing some of your food with them, one in particular takes a liking ot you, and allows you on their back.\nWhat does your steed call you?
A flock of white birds join you in your search. They are strange and crazy and happy and fun! One in particular takes a liking to you and becomes your constant companion. What does it call you?
Night falls as you find a cave and hang from its rafters. Even in you isolation, you find a quite ally in the darkness.\nWhat do they call you?
Fiery wings lift you into the sky, and ignite dry lands. In the ashes of your power, phoenixes are reborn in flame and join you. One in particular grows close to you.\n It asks you your name.

Your search for knowledge bring your flight to the shoreline, where mystics feed the gulls. Upon descending, you decide to study with them. Your absolute freedom and knowledge attracts a small blue bird that accompanies you on your many adventures.\nIt asks your name

You use your freedom to seek more resources and find kinship among the birds of the forest. Their happy aspect is mirrored by their focus on gaining resources, and this resonates with you. One in particular becomes your constant companion.\nIt asks you your name

You find friends among the many birds in the sky. Together you form a community with the freedom to travel where ever you please.\nYou mentor one of them who becomes your constant companion. Who does it learn from?
But it is not your voice
Wake up sleepyhead! We don\'t have time for you to lay in bed all day!
Forget you bro, I\'m sleeping in
Up and at \'em bro! How can I help?
Don\'t make me ask again, as your elder, dad put me in change, and I will whup you if I need to!
Calm down, what do you need?
Alright, alright, what do you need?
I\'m sorry, what do you need?
Just kidding bro, how can I help?
That\'s what I thought you\'d say. Dad has got some chores for you to do, and don\'t forget your writing lesson with Brahm.
Thanks, but I do what I want
What are you talking about? I\'m your older brother John
Oh John right. What was that you needed?
I\'ve never seen you before in my life!
You ain\'t so young I can\'t whup you! [Your brother punches you]. Now dad has got some chores for you to do, and don\'t forget your writing lesson with Brahm.
Thanks, but I do what I want
You don\'t remember what day it is do you? Its been 5 years since mom left, hes going to spend the day at church praying for her safety.
I should go pray for her too
Who cares? Shes been gone a long time
The storyteller and librarian, but try to keep him on topic, he can rant about anything and everything for days.

You\'re going to get yourself in trouble one of these days, but I guess you\'re old enough to make your own mistakes. Dad has some chores for you to do, and don\'t forget your writing lesson with Brahm.
You should know better than that by now; Dad\'s not going to put up with your attitude. Now quit whining and remember to see Brahm at his house, then Dad at the church
No, I\'m going to do what I want
Don\'t forget to go see Brahm when you\'re done, he\'s the storyteller living in the old house by the gate.
No, I\'m going to go do what I want
She\'s gone and she\'s not coming back. The sooner you two realize that the better.
I\'ll still pray for her safety, wherever she is
When you get done with Brahm, don\'t forget to see Dad in the church, he\'s got chores for you.
No, I\'m going to do what I want
What are you talking about? You\'ve seen me every day of your life. Quit joking around!
Yeah bro, I was just joking
I\'m not joking, I don\'t know who you are
Sure, but don\'t horse around all day, there will be plenty of time for that when your chores are done.
I do though. If she loved us she\'d be back already
I\'m gonna pray for her anyway
You do that, but remember your lessons with Brahm when you\'re done
Calm down, I believe you. I\'m taking you to our mystic, Brahm, He\'ll know what to do.
I believe you. I\'m taking you to our mystic, Brahm, He\'ll know what to do.
That\'s not how you talk about family. I\'m disappointed that you would say something like that. She\'s our mother and she loves you.
She abandoned us. Sooner you learn that the better
It\'s not that simple. One day Dad will explain to you why mom left. Right now you are too young.\nDon\'t forget after you see dad to go to your writing lesson with Brahm
No, I\'m going to go do what I want
It\'s okay, I\'m angry too. It\'s hard to remember that mom is just a person, and no one is perfect.\nDon\'t forget after you see dad to go to your writing lesson with Brahm
No, I\'m going to go do what I want
Listen, I know things have been hard since mom left, but you have a choice to try and make things better or make things worse.
Don\'t tell me what to do
You catch a glimpse of yourself in the mirror. Yet something seems strange… does that look right?\nPronouns:
You enter the small town of Oaktree, bustling in the noonday sun. Children play happily in the streets while their elders play stones beneath the great Oak tree around which the city was founded
As you enter the church, the young pastor smiles and greets you.\n
, I haven\'t seen you in church lately, is aught amiss?
I have more questions than faith
I come when I can father
I do come! I love your sermons!
how may I be of service?
I\'m just here to see my dad
I have questions about the gods
Do you have a quest for me?
Welcome back rascal, have you come to insult the church further?
I have come to make amends
Just here to see my dad
Wanted to know more about the Gods
Would like to pay a tithe
So good to see you my child! How may I be of service?
Wanted to learn more about the Gods
If it isn\'t my favorite congregant! How may I be of service?
Wanted to learn more about the Gods
If it isn\'t my wise young pupil, how fare your studies? Is there aught i can help with?
Wanted to learn more about the Gods
There is a nuance to the message… for those that pay attention. What do you want?
I\'m here to see my dad
There is a place for questions, as there is a place for answers, but not all questions have easy answers. To bridge this gap, there is faith
I believe in facts, not faith
I\'m here for my father, not to argue
May I study with you to learn faith?
Do not neglect your faith, my child. Much can be gained from prayer and contemplation. Now how may I help you?
I\'m here for my father, have you seen him?

I must have missed you in the pews! Forgive me my child. Your continued dedication to the faith deserves a reward, let me teach you how to bless monsters, this will allow you to catch divine monsters. Do not fret if you fail the first time! Much like life, renewed practice will make your blessing stronger and stronger, and more likely to bring monsters to your side. Now how can I help you today?
I was just kidding, I don\'t care
Actually, have you seen my dad?

Be careful how you speak of the Gods. Though their judgement is delayed till reckoning, they count your sins. Be careful child, your self concern will bring you pain as night follows day. But it is not to late to abandon your dark path. Go to Kyler, in the rundown house, who has also lost his way. Perhaps together you can come back to the light.
He is at the front pew in prayer and contemplation. Pray that if you must disturb him, do it briefly
Please do not loiter, this is a place of prayer and meditation, not for \'hanging out\'
I\'m here to see my dad
I\'d like to pay a tithe

Then know this: Put your concern for others always above your concern for yourself. Prayer is good, but prayer without action is dead. Do not contemplate the heavens, instead help those here on earth. Here is your task: Your father is suffering, go to him and do your best to relieve his burdens.
There is no cause to be rude. Why are you here?
I\'m here to see my dad
I\'d like to pay a tithe
I will pray for you my child. Now why are you here?
I\'m here to see my dad
I\'d like to pay a tithe
I can see you are in pain, and I recognize I cannot relate to you. Isolation is a terrible burden. Kyler may relate to you in a way I cannot, sometimes by helping others, we help ourselves
I\'m actually here for my dad
The dark path is not one you should seek to tread. Take care it does not consume you.\n Now why are you here?
I\'m here to see my dad
I\'d like to pay a tithe
*Your father is silent for a moment, even after you approach*\n Hey
*he wipes away a tear in his eye* I have some chores for you.
Go on now, finish your chores, after we can meet your brother at the tavern for dinner
How was the writing lesson with Brahm?
How was Morn doing? He was an adventurer, you know, before he took that arrow to the knee.
I got to fight some bulbapups!
I see you\'ve sold your mom\'s old necklace. Keep the money for now, I want to see if you can hang on to it.
I see you\'ve finished all your chores, are you ready to go have dinner?
No I\'d rather go play first

Your will is strong but I\'m afraid your purse is light, come back later. Tithes are well and good,but they do not replace good acts. If you cannot contribute materially, contribute to your fellow man in other ways.
Very well, but do not donate more than you can spare. Tithes are well and good,but they do not replace good acts. If you cannot contribute materially, contribute to your fellow man in other ways.
Thank you for your donation, now how may I help you?
I\'m here to see my dad
I\'d like to pay another tithe
There are some things I need you to do. First, remember your lesson with Brahm, then help Morn at his bar. Also I want you to sell this necklace, and bring me the money from the sale.
No. You don\'t have to do anything. Perhaps today we just sit in misery, and do nothing. But you should learn: action is the solution to anxiety, and it is better to do what you can than do nothing
You\'re right, how can I help?
*A tear slips from his eye*\n She doesn\'t need it anymore. I kept this thinking she would come back, and I need to let it go.
No. I\'ll find the money some other way
That may be true for now, but you will learn that real freedom is found in providing for others. Helping others is what gives life meaning
Then you will only ever comprehend part of the mystery, and will be poorer for it. Now how can I help you today?
I\'m here to see my dad
I\'d like to pay a tithe
Have you come for your writing lesson?
Can we just say we did?
Do you have any books on the Gods?
Could you teach me about magic?
I want to learn about Monsters
Can we get this over with?
Welcome back. Would you like to peruse the library?
Ahh yes. Today is the anniversary of your mother\'s departure is it not? I imagine such a time must be stressful for one so young. If you\'d like, we can talk about it before your lesson.
No, I\'d rather do the lesson
Why do you think she left?
Hmph. Michael, I\'m sure will be pleased by your devotion. Very well, I suppose today we should copy \"Five Faces, One God\" an old text written soon after the ascension of prophet Erebius.
Can we read something else instead?
Thank you, I found him wounded some months ago, and since rehabilitating him we have become close.

Ahh then we should begin with \"The Mysteries of Mana\" a primer on such things. An old tome, but its relevancy has persevered in the many years since it was written. Here is your pen and paper, now try and follow me
I don\'t want to READ about it, I want to practice it!

Monsters are a mystery from ancient times, one we know of yet little. We know that some people can \'master\' monsters, control them and drive them to their ends. Some say all can do it, though few try. There is a stigma for such men, the ignorant call them beasts, though there have been heroes that were masters, as surely as there have been villains.

Do not be so hasty. It is better to do a thing well than to do a thing quickly. What text would you like to study? You are ready for one of the following primers: Five Faces, One God, a religious text; Mysteries of Mana, a primer on magic; Mixed Party Tactics, a book about how to organize a small party in combat, Property ownership, a ponderous tome on stewardship, or Merchant Adventures, a classic adventure that may lift your spirits
Actually I\'m going to go play
Very well. I shall relent. Though I am here if you ever need me.\nWhat book should we scribe today?
Actually I\'m going to go play

She left because she had too. That is the great challenge of life. You see your friend\'s mothers and think \"That is what a mother is\" but not everyone can meet those standards. I was angry with my own parents for a long time, for what their parents did to them. In the end, we are all people - flawed, and we fall short of our goals.
You knew my mom, why did she leave?
Can we just do a writing lesson?

He is the ancient warrior prophet who united the six stones a thousand years ago, and in so doing united the world against a great darkness. Upon his victory, he ascended into haven, then travelled the world seeking those worthy of becoming Gods. He found five: Ahros, Velhu, Sid, Gabriel and Pythion. Together they formed the early church.
Can we please get this over with?

Very well, here is your pen and paper, follow me. \"Time is reckoned by the choice of God, not men. Anu, father of all, has watched over us since the beginning, yet he was faceless until Erebius, the great prophet, united the six stones. When this was done, he ascended into heaven, and came down to find the faces of God in men.

Very well, what would you like to read? You are ready for one of the following primers: Five Faces, One God, a religious text; Mysteries of Mana, a primer on magic; Mixed Party Tactics, a book about how to organize a small party in combat, Property ownership, a ponderous tome on stewardship, or Merchant Adventures, a classic adventure that may lift your spirits
Actually I\'m going to go play
He is a wild thing yet, not a pet. Let us focus on the issue at hand. What book will we be transcribing today?
Actually I\'m going to go play

Practicing a thing before you understand it is a sure route to failure, and failure at magic can be disastrous. Patience, I will teach you some of what you seek in time, but let us begin at the beginning, and take each step on the journey in its own time.

A weak one, of sorts. Bonding is not simple. My way was simply to feed them, calm them. Attacking them is a sure way to keep them from bonding, instead their attacks must be endured. Mastering a monster is a tricky thing, with many variables at play. You are more likely to master those that match your elemental nature, and those that you are much stronger than.
Can we get on with the lesson?
I\'m going to master them all!

You may already be one. Yet monsters respect those that have power, be it martial, arcane, or otherwise. If you truly wish to master monsters remember this: They will follow those that match their nature, and will change your nature as surely as you change theirs. Beware the darkness, and the flame as they can take you down dark paths.
I will not live in fear
I understand. Now can we get to the lesson?

Thus year one of our calendar was reckoned as Erebius began his pilgrimage seeking those who embodied Anu\'s virtues. First he met a pious king, named Ahros, who had served him in his war. Erebius did not elevate him for his righteous authority, but for the prudence and humility with which he judged his fellow man. Thus Ahros knelt before Erebius, and rose again as Ahros, God of Justice, first face of Anu.
We have only just begun, but very well. May the joy of youth blossom in your heart, as you go and have many misadventures.

Erebius brought his traitorous servant Pythion before Ahros, and asked the God-King to pass judgement. Ahros replied:\"The law of balance decrees that Pythion should have the evil he had done others done to himself in the same measure\". Ahros rose with the Sun, and was bathed in its light as he ascended to heaven, that he may judge men in the next life as he did in this.
I\'m bored, can we stop now?

As the sun set on the day of his victory, Erebius was bathed in the light of the full moon. He travelled to the western shore, where a mystic was meditating on a rock. So strong was her magic that beams of light shone upon her. Erebius asked her: \"Mystic, what is the purpose of magic?\" She replied: \"To do that which is right, to serve both God and men.\"
I\'m bored, can we stop now?
That is enough. The young still have fire in their veins it seems. Go play, and may you get onto as much mischief as you can manage

So Erebius asked the Mystic:"My servant Pythion betrayed me, yet I prevailed. What is to be done with him?" So she asked: "What were his reasons?"
 "He feared me a tyrant, and believed none should have the power of the stones united."
"Was he right?"
"I do not know"
"Then show him mercy, as his cause was just."
I\'m bored, can we stop now?

By the light of the moon, Velhu ascended to the heavens, goddess of mercy, wisdom, and magic. So Erebius travelled to the north, directed by divine inspiration. There he met a monk, meditating beneath the roots of a great tree.
He asked this monk:"What is the way?"
The monk said only:"Practice compassion"
"My servant Pythion betrayed me, yet I prevailed. What should I do with him?"

The monk said only \"Practice compassion\"\nBelieving in his wisdom, Erebius granted him divinity, yet the monk, Sid, relented. \"I do not wish for heaven.\" he said, \"My place is here on hexheim, where I can yet be of service.\"\nErebius granted him this, and Sid became one with the great Tree, which watches over mankind to this day.

As you say. Your writing lesson is done, go out and have many adventures, while you are still young enough to enjoy them. Later, you can come back and study the other books if you\'d like. My library is always open to you.

After Erebius found Sid, an angel descended from the Heavens. \"I am Gabriel,\" the angel said, \"Servant of the Gods. I serve missionaries and pilgrims, that they can find their way to his grace.\"\n\"No.\" Erebius said. \"You are servant no longer. I name you the fourth face of God, that you may serve the righteous, and protect those on the road. What should I do with Pythion, who betrayed me?\"

"Should he repent, let him make pilgrimage, that he may find his way back to the light. Should he not seek the light, prevent him from spreading his darkness."
Gabriel then ascended to heaven on his angelic wings. Erebius turned to his traitor, his prisoner and his friend. "What should I do with you?"
"Let me find Redemption." Pythion said. "And bring others that have lost their way back to the light." 
And so it was.
An interesting story. Are we done now?
The texts do not say. Tradition has it that the great prophet went to the east, and was lost.
Cool, I\'m going to go play
Go play and finish your chores, I\'ll tell your father you completed your lesson
Not a bad choice, Mysteries of Mana is an excellent primer on magical education. Now here is your quill and paper, follow after me.
Actually I\'m going to play outside
Don\'t let me stop you. We can study when you are older. Though I will have to tell your father
Alright alright, lets just make this quick

Magic, in its many forms, has a wide variety of uses and expressions, however structurally, 3 things remain mechanically constant. Mana, or the power that is used to cast spells, has a source from which it originates, a channel through which it travels to its destination, and an expression. The expression is the effect of mana, which can vary from mending wounds to fire and lightning and other effects

The source determines the moral \'character\' of the magic - which magistars, the church\'s magic police care greatly about. The source of White magic is the God\'s themselves, and can be granted or taken by them at a whim, while Grey magic uses the innate magic from an individual. This is more reliable in some ways, because a person can always access their own magic, and less because unlike white magic, grey magic energy is finite.
I\'m bored, I\'m going to leave now

Black magic, or \'evil\' magic has a source external to one\'s self, and is illegal and condemned.\nThe channel determines how much power can be used at once, even if the caster has an infinite source, they can only use as much as they can channel at one time. Likewise, if their source is depeleted, their channel will do them no good, as they will have nothing to draw upon.
I\'m bored, can we stop now?

Expressions have elements, same as people. Fire expressions can be used to light fires, inflict damage on the enemy etc, while light expressions might heal or protect. People with a red nature will find their red expressions much stronger than people with a blue nature for instance. Fire monsters will also be more willing to serve a master with a red nature, and will be more powerful under a red master\'s command.
I will tell your father you did well.
Wait, aren\'t you going to teach me some magic?
Very well, this is the basic water spell \'bubble\'. Take care to use it only in defense, and not on your brother. Practice well, it will become stronger the more you use it.
Wait, can\'t you teach me something more powerful?
I could, but you must walk before you can run. Now off with you! Go get in trouble like all young people should.
Good choice, Mixed Party Tactics is an excellent primer on combat, and will teach fundamentals that will serve you well, both in and out of battle. Now here is your quill and paper, follow after me.
Actually I\'m going to play outside

Combat is a violent brutal game, and one that must be won. When there are multiple combatants on each side, organization is the key to victory. Though there are exceptions, combatants typically fall into one of three categories. 1) Tanks whose job is to withstand damage so it does not fall upon weaker party members, 2) Glass cannons that deal incredible damage but are themselves vulnerable, and 3) Healers, buffers, and debuffers that help the party in different ways.
This is so boring, can I leave now?

Organization is key- keep the tanks and those that can take damage in the front, while leaving the glass cannons and healers in the back. If you have multiple tanks, or those that can soak damage, put the primary tank in the center of the front, where they will receive the most attention from foes, while leaving weaker tanks to the sides.

True masters of combat will defeat their enemies before they have a chance to strike. This means that typically slow, defensive tanks will contribute very little to this stratedgy. Synergize your slow physical tank with fast Glass cannons, and exploit elemental weaknesses for extra damage.
I\'m bored. Are we almost done yet?

Almost everything has an elemental nature, and each nature has advantages and disadvantages for each type of enemy. For instance, a water elemental will find their attacks especially effective against fire elementals, as fire will for air, air will for earth, and earth will for water. Moral Elements (Light and Darkness) are offensively strong against each other while being defensively weak against each other.
I\'m going to go play outside.

So if you are in a battle between light and darkness, the surest way to victory is to strike first. A wise party leader will keep a variety of elementals around themselves, so that they can handle any situation that might come. Sneaking around an opponents tank to quickly kill their glass cannons before they can strike is an effective stratedgy as well.
That\'s sc cool! I can\'t wait to practice what I\'ve learned
I pray you will not have to anytime soon. But if you do, pray try to be merciful if you can, the gods look poorly on those that kill fleeing or downed enemies.
I will only kill if I have to
I kill when I please, they were fighting me after all

I pray that you will always have that option, as violence begets violence, but life is not always so black and white. The correct way is to kill as rarely as you can, and only when you must. This will keep the gods on your side, and prevent you from being a victim of retribution from the fallen\'s family.

This is the way. Leave killing as an option, but reserve it for only the most dire circumstances. Violence begets violence, and mercy may make allies of enemies. Now begone! It is not good for the young to listen to the old prattle. Go have an adventure, and make as much trouble as you can manage

Fail to extend mercy to your enemy, and they will do the same for you. No person is strong enough to win every battle, and wanton murder will lead you down a dark path. The Tyrant does not rule through force alone, as three subordinates with half his strength can dethrone him.
You\'re right, I will only kill when I must
I will fear nothing, and do as I please
Mercy is weakness, inviting the defeated to rise again
I am glad you were willing to listen. Now begone! It is not good for the young to listen to the old prattle. Go have an adventure, and make as much trouble as you can manage

You may speak for the shock value, but murder is not as easy as you may think. I will have to speak to your father of this. Now begone! It is not good for the young to listen to the old prattle. Go have an adventure, and make as much trouble as you can manage.

Ahh I didn\'t realize you were so economically minded. Property Ownership will certainly teach you how to invest and take care of your investments. Money makes the world go around after all. Be cautious though, as money is a good servant and a bad master; it should be a means to an end, not an end in itself
Actually I\'m going to go play outside.

Love of money is the root of all evil, so good men tend to be poor. I\'d rather be rich myself, and leave morality to the priests. Investment is the key to moving up in this world, and to do that, you need a principle, typically 1,000 gold to get your skin in the game. This is called \'purchasing a property license\' and can be done at any city hall. Unfortunately you will need a different license for each city you invest in.
I\'m bored, I\'m going to leave now

After you\'ve bought a property license though, you can invest your hard earned money in businesses and real estate, which will typically yeild 1/1000th of the money you invested in them each day. This doesn\'t sound like much, but if you invest the money you earn in investing in investing, you can make a feedback loop that will make you very financially secure.

Be careful though, becoming absurdly wealthy without donating will upset the divines and the government. Therefore, after earning 1000 gold, consider donating 10% of your earnings to charity to keep the law and the Gods off of your back. Failure to do so will make you seem like a greedy prick, but it\'s your money, do with it as you will.
Why aren\'t you super rich Brahm, if you know all this?
I can\'t wait to have a whole lot of money!
Never had the talent for it, I always liked spending my money, not saving

Remember what I said earlier, money on its own is great, but it is more valuable as a tool than as an end in itself. Use your resources to help others, and you will count yourself richer than a king. Hoard it, and you will have only false friends and scyophants.
You\'re right, I\'ll remember to help others
Let them take care of themselves, it\'s more important to be rich and powerful
Now begone! It is not good for the young to listen to the old prattle. Go have an adventure, and make as much trouble as you can manage

You are still young. You will grow to care for others as you mature. Now begone! It is not good for the young to listen to the old prattle. Go have an adventure, and make as much trouble as you can manage
Ah a robust and exciting tome! Let\'s go ahead and get started, here is your quill and paper.
Actually I\'m going to go play outside

The economy of Hexheim is living and dynamic. The value of a good at one place is not necessarily the value at another. The key is to buy low, where a good is produced or common, then sell high at a place where a good is rare. Be careful however, the more of a good you dump in a town, the less each consecutive unit of that good will be worth.
I\'m bored, I want to leave now

Common goods can be harvested from slain monsters, though more valuable commodities will be found the more dangerous monster you encounter. Selling these goods immediately is unwise however, as they are worth more in far away lands. Because inventory management is boring, each person can have as many of an item as they please, how convenient!

Remember, in the economy as in all things, the greater risk the greater reward. Target a sensible, achieveable economic goal like making a profit on a sale, before targeting a more difficult one, like property ownership. Remember: One small step at a time, and many small steps can lead to bigger steps in the future!

Your mother loved you. She left because she had no other choice. Resentment and hatred are natural, but they do not serve you. Try to forgive her for falling short of your expectations. The priest Michael would tell you to have compassion, and instead have gratitude for what you do have, a father and brother that love you.
He would tell you this is what the Gods want, and maybe he is right, I don\'t know. What I do know is this: Resentment doesn\'t serve you. Don\'t let go for the gods, let go for yourself.
Will I ever see my mom again?

I cannot say. She may yet return from her journeys, but I would not dwell upon it. Instead of wasting away, dreaming of a future that may never come, live in the present moment, and focus on what\'s in front of you. Do not be trapped in a future that may never come.

My mother was a village witch, and though I asked many times, she never told me of my father. I am old now, so he is most certainly gone. She died sometime when I was drafted in the war with the easter empire. When I returned some thirty years ago, she was gone
I\'m ready for a writing lesson now
It is an old wound, and long healed. Now what book would you like to study?
Actually I\'m going to go play

That is a matter of some debate. There are records of him in the east, in a dark land he tried and failed to bring to light. He fought for so long and so hard, some say he couldn\'t stop fighting, until finally he found someone more powerful. Others say he was cursed, or took a curse from an innocent upon himself. The truth though, we will never know.
Can I learn more about him?
I don\'t really care, can I go play?

There is a god for each virtue: Ahros symbolizes justice and martial authority, while Velhu is mercy and magical regulation. Sid is boundless compassion, and Gabriel is sharing and spreading the light. Pythion is for those that have lost their way, to come back to the light
Can we return to the lesson?
I\'m not the right person to ask unfortunately, direct your inquiries to Michael at the church next time you see him, I\'m sure he would give a better explanation
I will, but lets finish this lesson up
I changed my mind actually, I\'m gonna go play

Ah a bold claim! I envy your youth and excitment. Perhaps you will, though it has never been done before. It will require a lot of work, monsters need much care. Mastering and caring for more than 300 will be quite the achievement.
I have to take care of them?
Can we return to the lesson?

No one is quite sure, as new species are being found all the time. Some are known to only be found during certain times of the year, while others have to be specifically bred to appear. Focus on catching one first, you will see they can be quite a bit to handle!
I have to take care of them?
Can we return to the lesson?

Yes, monsters require constant care. You can pay others to board and feed them, but its not cheap. The wise way is to first earn some passive income so you can spend it on your monsters. Those that are not cared for may run back into the wild.
Can we return to the lesson?
Fear does not serve you, yet caution is useful. Balance is the key.
Can we get to the lesson?
Actually, I\'m going to go play

We simply do not know. The ascension was a long time ago, if Erebius was mortal, he is surely dead. If he was immortal, there has been no record of him. If time does not touch him, he is either hidden in secret, or imprisoned, or both
That\'s interesting, but enough for one day. I\'m going to go finish my chores and play

, though later in life, you may find that work is a blessing, and not a curse

In the forest, defeat a bulbapup in combat, and you will be able to collect its bulb.
Add to a pile, and the pile is bigger yes? Remove from it and it is smaller? As so with fate. If we make life better, it becomes better, isn\'t it so?

, don\'t let me keep you. If you get in trouble, don\'t get caught

And yet, still you can improve the fates of others, or reduce them. Now, I believe your father sent you to me for chores- go collect three onions from bulbapups in the forest, and you can have the rest of the day to yourself.
Yellow eyes are not so rare where I come from, in the east, an Air nature is as common as Earth nature here in the west.

There are six elemental natures in this world, as the gods have made it so: Light, for those with white eyes, Dark for those with black, Water for people with blue eyes. People with green or brown eyes are earth, yellow eyes for Air, and Red Eyes for Fire. A person\'s eye can tell you much.
Dad said you\'d have chores for me
The young have grey eyes until they\'ve settled into their nature- Your nature has yet to be decided young one.

'tween what things seem and what they are.

perhaps I can interest you in a quest when you get back

tell you what, I\'ll give you 20 gold and a week. Come back with 22 gold by the end of this week, and you can have your necklace back, otherwise it\'s mine. Sound fair?
Ahh, you say that now, but you\'ll learn one day that some things are worth more than gold. If you\'d rather not sell it, you can pawn it if you\'d like

What is mine to forgive, I do, but it is not me you have mocked. Three things you must do to follow Pythion\'s path to redemption. One, Speak with Kyler to bring him to light. Two, pay a tithe of 10 gold to the church. Three, destroy a heathen statue not far from town.

There is only one God, though he has five faces. He is the great God Anu, represented to man in five forms: Ahros the Judge, Velhu the Mystic, Sid the Monk, Gabriel the Missionary, and Pythion the redeemer.
Tell me about a specific God

The Gods were found by the prophet Erebius after he won the holy war to begin the age. He united the six sacred stones, and so ascended to heaven to meet Anu. On his return, he found Anu\'s reflection in five devoted servants.

Each god represents one of the five great virtues. Ahros, the Judge, represents Justice: The equitable and appropriate application of physical power. Vehlu represents Mercy: which balances Ahros\' strength.

The Priesthood of Anu oversees the five diocese: the Ahros\' Justicars, judges and warriors who enforce the law, Velhu\'sMagistars who govern magic, Sid\'s monks, who heal the sick, Gabriel\'s missionaires, who spread the good word, and Pythion\'s redeemers who bring the guilty back to light
Tell me about a specific God

That may be, but still I do have some quests for you. First, speak with Kyler to try and bring him back to the light, then donate 10 gold to the church, and after that destroy a pagan statue in the woods for me
Is there aught else I can help you with?
I\'m just here to see my dad
I have questions about the gods
Do you have a quest for me?
Leave me child. But remember this: no matter how far you fall into darkness, there is always a path back to the light.
Which of Anu\'s faces would you like to know more about?

Ahros was a great an just king who served Erebius in his crusade, while Velhu helped him with her magic. Sid the healer, saved the wounded, while Gabriel, the archangel descended with Erebius to spread the message of Anu.
The last, Pythion, was once a servant of Erebius, but betrayed him before the last battle. After speaking with the new Gods, they allowed him to shephard the lost back to the light.
Tell me about a specific God

Sid represents compassion: putting others above oneself, while Gabriel is the representative of the holy truth, honesty and integrity. Pythion represents redemption, finding one\'s way back to the light
Tell me about a specific God

Ahros, the God of Justice, often associated with the sun, was known as a great and just ruler before granted ascension from Erebius. He judges the faithful dead and distributes the rewards of the afterlife to them. He founded the Justicars, who judge the living to this day, as he judges them in death.

Velhu, mother of the moon, was found by Erebius on a shard of the moon that fell from the sky. That stone is the most potent magical artifact on this planet, which the college of the Magi built their tower over, to the chagrin of Velhu\'s Magistars to this day.

Sid, God of compassion, was a nonviolent monk an healer in life, who starved himself so others could eat, abstained from meat, alcohol, sex, and dishonesty. He is a friend to animals, and could calm a raging bull at a glance.

Archangel Gabriel was sent by Anu with Erebius after he united the six stones an eon ago. He shephards missionaries, and tries to convert the faithless back to the light, and has an order of missionaries devoted to such a cause.
Pythion was once a servant of the prophet Erebius, but betrayed him before the final battle. Erebius allowed him redemption, however, and he was elevated to bring those that fall back to the light
There are no others. We call the faces Gods because they are fractions of the one true God Anu. There are greater and lesser evil spirits Anu sends to tempt us, but only he is a true God.
On the Mortal plane, Velhu and her magistars (or magic police) are most concerned with the proper application and use of mystic power, and hunt demon

After his ascention, he meditated before a great tree, now called the tree of the living God, in the northern forest, which he melded with. He is the only God that did not ascend with Erebius, but remains in tree form helping mankind too this day
He is also guides the demontamers, a faction of monks who teach others to master the darkness inside of them, and in extreme cases, will take that darkness on themselves.
He stewards a faction of ex criminals and brings them back to the light.

The absolute background behind everything else
The relative \'top\' third(ish) of the display, typically used to prompt the player
The relative \'center\' of the display, typically used to set an image for the scene for the user
The relative \'bottom\' of the display, typically used to get input from the user

The first TextView shown when cinematically showing text, should be aligned to the top of the screen, usually set to invisible. The cinematic text will be aligned in approximately the top two thirds of the screen, from the top of the parent (and background top) to the bottom of background_center
The second TextView shown when cinematically showing text, usually set to invisible
The third TextView shown when cinematically showing text, usually set to invisible
The fourth TextView shown when cinematically showing text, usually set to invisible
The fifth TextView shown when cinematically displaying text, usually set to invisible

The last Text View displayed when cinematically displaying text, usually set to invisible, aligned to right above the bottom 3rd of the screen

The content in the third choice the player has, usually in the middle left of the bottom third screen
The content in the fourth choice the player has, usually in the middle right of the bottom third screen

Young spirits made of flame that snap and spit at anything that comes near. Their white eyes burn with anger at whatever they see.
Minor demon, made of flame. Their arms are glowing iron blades, that they may never put down. They are cursed for their violence to never cease.
Young flaming fox cubs dashing this way and that, famed both for their agility and their inability to slow down.
Magical symbols of the eternal flame, Pyro Symbols spark and burn to the touch. It is said they can see the future in the fire.
Wingless drakes whose skin is lit aflame, the Pyos are known for their ferocity in combat and the red fire that spills from their jaws.
The adolescent comet has grown black horns from its wolflike body as a result of its propensity to bash its head into whatever its running at.
A sentient red and orange stone, the is an enchanted rock that hovers at chest level. Large as a big pot, they are known for their fierce loyalty to their masters, as well as their unquenchable heat.
A large Pyro Symbol has attracted three smaller symbols to better channel its potent magics.
Greater demons with horns and wings, the flames of its breath and whip are legendary.
When Comets have been consumed by their anger, they form into a Bolides, huge comets whose speed only ceases at their deaths. Its very speed ignites the air, burning all in its path.
The Fire Opal has hardened and its power has increased tenfold, granting it a brighter sheen and allowing it to cast magic and attack physically with ever more vigor.
The Primordial Pyro Elemental, has grown and now dominates 6 smaller symbols, one for each element. It channels these symbols to cast all manner of spells, making it a true master of elemental magic.
A lesser son of Vulcan. though it is fire elemental, it is known for its somber mood, unlike other fire primaries

Creops is a man size titan with a face of melting stone. Lava flows from its heart, a furnace controlling the stone and giving it life; its heart is also its weak spot. Small horns have sprouted from its head, that it uses mainly for defense.

The Philamon melted in the heat of the planet\'s mantle, dissolving into its constituent parts. After basking in the heat, it formed a sentient puddle of oil, giving off noxious, flammable fumes. It is fued by its anger, and enjoys being lit on fire.
A floating sphere of lava that glows and pulses from yellow to orange. It has a cracked shell of earth protecting it, within which the core dwells.

An eight-foot tall fire monster with horns jutting from his head, made of lava and hunks of rock. His weak point is his molten heart, glowing near the center of his chest. It is protected by transparent rock. The more of this rock that is chipped away, the angrier and more dangerous he becomes. His horns have formed a kind of crown on his head, a claim of indomitable strength- defying a challenger to attack him.

Spilling out from the earths molten core, this pool of lava is dangerous, spitting molten lava at all those around it, as if the pool itself is angry. It has feasted on the fumes and the heat of the core for an age, and now wishes to burn the overworld to make it another fiery home.

A floating lava-snake with two tails extending and circling around it. It has two tails so it can channel two different spells separately, one in each tendril. It has a molten core strongest at its center, that extends through each arm.

A walking colossus of molten iron. Iron plates still red-hot protect the vulnerable molten core within, making the colossus near-impenetrable, except at the joints, which are still molten. Its rock hard horns now curl down each side giving it a terrifying appearance (like Durin\'s bane from the Tolkien universe).

Heat and Noxious fumes erupt from this red lake, as if from the bowels of hell itself. It has come to overhwelm the surface world with its fiery wrath, and consumes all in its path, especially metals which strenthen iit. Ice is the only sure way of stopping it.

An actual lava dragon, snakelike with giant horns. A master of magic, it casts both fire and water in tandem with its breath, channeling the energies through its two massive horns. Unlike the Vulcanous, its core is a thin snake inside of it, allowing it to move more quickly, leaving it more vulnerable to attack, but also allowing it to channel energy from its surroundings more effectively.

A limbless snake that dwells in hot places, typically deserts or volcanoes. It will bite when threatened. It is called a Salamander because of the myth that it can breathe fire, although it seems when angered, a small flame will light in the back of its throat. It is much weaker in colder climes, and its hide is behind only drakescale and dragonbone in terms of fire protection.
Though weak on its own, Raptors, when working together can take down much larger prey. They are famed for their cunning and cruelty, often taking time to give the meat its \'savor\'.

A small flying dinosaur that resembles a bat, except for its cone-shaped head and large teeth. Wingers are known for their great vision and speed, often killing smaller prey before they knew they were under attack. The hooks in their wings, though small are devastatingly sharp and can rend through any armor with the slightest flaw.

Large for an adolescent, the Herbisaur is a dinosaur that is slow target- but beefy. Its skin is so thick and tough that often predators will grow tired and seek different prey. Herbisaurs are named because they don\'t eat any meat, but they eat nearly everything else- all the time. Many use this to explain why they are so large at such a young age.

A giant monster with huge jaws capable of enveloping a human whole, the tyrant is the lord of the plains. Its skin is charcoal grey because it nests in the charred hides of its prey. Tyrants are known for their ability to breathe fire, which it often does to quickly kill enemies that are too fast to catch.

A larger Winger with a steel beak and wings. The winger thought it would be cool to go steel, but it didn\'t account for the weight, which slows it down and in extreme cases keeps it from flying. The added defense is exceptional though, and the steel hooks in its claws and beak have an even greater penetrating effect than the raw bone of the Winger.

A massive monster that has spikes protruding from every inch of its hide, The Spikevorsaur is a superb defensive combatant. Though slow, it can bellow at enemies, enraging the stupid and aggressive, to protect its fellow monsters. It uses the same call in mating, and female Spikevorsaurs favor a mate with large, pointy spikes, the redder the better.

Decades of curing scale plate with the ashes of fallen enemies have turned the Tyrants scales and horns white- a manner of bone harder even than steel. Its gaze is said to so terrifying that its prey freezes in fear when they meet it. Why this superstition is though, no one knows, as a meeting with a Great White Tyrant rarely leaves any survivors.

The EdgeWinger is and evolved SteelWinger, that shaved off the edges of the steel so that its really sharp- and light enough it can fly again. The edges of its wings (for which it is named) are so sharp that a thread, when dropped over them, is cut by its own weight. Natural bonesmiths revere the skeleton for its usefulness in making rare blades. It has enough weight and control in the sky that it can dive straight down at terrifying heights and speeds, slicing through it enemies without warning in an \'edge dive\'.

Most monsters draw within their bodies when they are old, leaving a bony outer shell to protect themselves. Not so the Broncheospikesaur. Its blood has developed regenerative capabilities and flows near the skin healing any minor damage. This doesn\'t make the Broncheospikesaur vulnerable, however, since it can near instantly regenerate any damage that penetrates its shell deep enough to strike blood. Its bleating roar is also famous for being able to enrage all opponents at once. That combined with the regeneration and the thorny skin make the Broncheospikesaur one of the most capable defensive monsters around.

The Kangarat is a small rodent that can spend its whole life without having to drink any water. It is wise in the ways of the desert, and knows where to hide during sandstorms. Unlike most furry creatures, it relishes having sand in its fur. It can tell the direction of the nearest water using its feet, and is a valued pet among the caravaneers that brave the desert.

A Slynx is a mythical sand cat that has haunting eyes and can speak, but only speaks in riddles. Whenever asked a question, it answers with another question, usually pointing at the right answer. If the Slynx has no clue though, it will just repeat the question asked of it, it is about the size of a mountain lion

A Scorpi is a small scorpion that is red and very venomous. It is not, however, poisonous, and baked Skorpi casserole is one of the delicacies in the desert, although it is very hot- usually too hot for foreigners.

A humpless is a sad camel without a hump. It can magically control the sand with its mind and keeps some in the gourd across its back. It is infamous for never getting any action, and that might be why its so sad. A charm shaped like a humpless us used to protect rich peoples daughters.

The Sphynx has the head of a man and the body of a lion, like the Slynx it evolved from, it speaks only in riddles, however, these riddles are more difficult. It lacks wings, although older Sphynx will grow them and use them for flight

A Scarpi is a large scorpion whose plates have turned into armor, although they do bear scars from its earlier encounters. It is named after the fabled storyteller who is credited with the creation of its myth. Indeed they were so rare that many didn\'t believe Scarpi when he told his stories. Obviously, the doubters were wrong.

A Unihump is a camel with a single hump. It stores water in this hump obviously and can cast sandstorm with its mind. Its fur is designed to cause a slight breeze beneath the heat, cooling it to prepare it for long days in the hot sands. Though slow, it is beloved by the caravaneers of the desert for its hardy ability to carry lots of weight, and for its general good nature.

The Greater Sphynx is a very large sphynx with haunting eyes that also speaks in riddles and analogies. Unlike its smaller cousings, it has large folded wings along its back. It can\'t fly with them, but when it spreads them out, it looks very intimidating. The feathers alternate between jade and turquoise, and as these are precious metals, the Greater Sphynx was once hunted for its wings. But then they killed and ate all the hunters after they failed their questions, so that was over quickly.

The Scorpious is a descendant of the giant Scorpion that killed Orion. Huge and black as night, its shiny carapace is highly valued in the eastern empire to use making armor and shields, for despite its black coloring, it is quite cool, even in the most desperate heat. Its terrible claws can burrow in the sand, making it disappear in moments, and reappear unexpectedly behind its prey.

The Bihump has mystical powers and can control sand with its mind. A loyal beast, it will entomb any that threaten its caravaneer masters in sand. It can cast Fire and Air magic simultaneously, one spell from each hump, and due to its hardiness and wisdom is a prized fighter in the desert arenas. It can be rather slow at times, but it is always a deliberate, directed action that is slow. The beast uses each moment to its fullest.

The youngest justice monster, Angiers are very concerned with right and wrong, although their own moral compass is still undeveloped. This can lead to interesting situations, commonly Angiers pray at altars too long, forsaking food and water, thinking it is the \'right\' thing to do. Part of their journey is learning moderation in the principles they stick to blindly.

The Justicar appears as a lesser knight in shining chainmail and a golden crest upon its helm. It holds a wooden shield painted white in its left hand with an iron sword in its right. It has a cloth half cape edged in yellow. The Justicar believes solidly in the rule of law and protects the weak. However, if it views the weak to be unvirtuous, it will leave them to suffer, believing that their karma will sort them out.

The Ayurved is a healer that calls upon faith to direct the healing of its god. It is better at healing the virtuous and refuses to touch the vile. The Angier it has grown from had its horns grow into scales on which it balances the morality of its target. It doesn\'t care whether the target is an enemy or a friend, it will only heal the virtuous and only harm the wicked.

The ordinator is a justicar who has served its term as a city guard and now goes forth to right whatever wrong it sees. It stands in shining white steel plate mail with a steel shield edged in gold with a knee-length white silk cape edged in gold.

The Anyr is a judge that has been given the full authority of the church to act in the interest of the greater good in whatever way it thinks best. It can only be second-guessed by a clergyman ranked bishop or higher. It has the ability to cast a spell that heals all light elementals and harms all dark elementals but does not discriminate between friend and foe. It is loosely based on the amyr form Patrick Rothfuss\' kingkiller chronicles. which you should read, by the way.
The Zireal is the angel of justice. Wears a white garb with a golden tassel. Blindfolded with a white cloth, but never misses. Wields a sword in one hand and a shield with scales in the other.
The Justicier is a quiet robed figure, who can speak into the ears of the wicked. For her, the ends justify the means, and any means will be used for the betterment of mankind.

Unsurprisingly, Spitens are known for being unforgiving and cruel. While not large enough to inflict the vengeance they desire, they still keep a list in their heads of all who wronged them- so their anger can be satisfied at a later date.

The Jacobia looks for all intents and purposes, a demon. It hates all the evil in the world with a passion. It represents the hotter, angrier side of vengeance. It plans to kill them all but does not realize, after all the evil has been slain, it will still have one last murder to perform. It does bonus damage to creatures with a dark element and less damage to creatures with a light element.

It is a play on the Elizabethan revenge tragedy. She has an obsidian curving circlet on her forehead, coming to a point in the center of her brow. Her skin is ashen, her hair bloodred, her eyes, that only open when she casts spells, are yellow. She represents the quiet revenge, cold and calculated, and speaks seldom, then only in a whisper. To tell her allies why they failed her, at the summit of their defeat.

A Letham is a creature that once loved passionately and had its love taken away. It looks like a human, except corrupted by anger and hate. It is slowly losing its sense of justice, and is beginning to admit to itself what it really wants. Its horns and claws are twisted and cruel- much like its soul.

The D\'Hoffry are male vengeance angels with red wings. They are crueler than their cousins, the Lethams, but much less vicious and able than their stronger female relatives, the Halfrecs. It channels hot vengeance energy through its red wings. The feathers of the wings are sharp, and can cut into the flesh of the guilty- their blood is what gives the wings their color, while their screams are what give his face its countenance. It is willing now- to do what is required in pursuit of its goals- no matter the cost.

The revenant wears Red steel, outlined with sharp blacklines. The full helm covers the entire head and has red horns, though whether these horns are a part of the helmet or the demon is unknown. Its claws appear sharp if worn down, but shine when covered with the blood of the guilty. The Revenants justified rage is old now- it has slain its enemy, though the cost was dear- it no longer recognizes itself, and on its path to vengeance, it has become something worse even than the evil it slew.

A Halfrec is a female vengeance demon with dark wings coated in spikes and cruel hooks. It is unforgiving and believes itself to be doing what is right. They are slowly coming back after a buff vampire slayer killed most of them. Unlike their cousins the D\'Hoffrys, the Halfrecs can channel and control their hate for better use later instead of exploding. This magical energy is concentrated in its large intricate red horns, that glow with hot rage energy that can be directed as the Halfrec wishes. It is the very embodiment of the phrase: \'Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned\'.

The minor steamlet is a young demon made of steam. It cannot be harmed by physical attacks but has very little health. A small amount of white phosporus drives its core, and if this phosporous is damaged, it will die quickly.

The lesser steamlet is a slightly older steamlet that can briefly dissipate and come back together. Is it strategically advantageous? Probably only if your delaying for the resurrection of a phoenix. A larger amount of white phosphorus is at its core, that allows it to live outside of its humid environment longer
A phantom of steam, seeming to appear and reappear at will, the Scaldar rejoices in wrapping itself around its enemies, burning them with its phantasmal body.

The Steamlet is a mature monster that no longer laughs at childish or raunchy jokes. As such, its soul is dead, and its not fun to be around, especially if its friends are older. It has uncommon yellow phosporous at its core.

This sentient ball of heat seeks out all non-steamlets who fail to fit in its domain. It delights particularly in burning and consuming the skin off of intruders, which it can consume with its corrosive vapors.

The Greater steamlet is known only by the rare master that tries to collect them all, because its relatively useless and very hard to obtain. As you are reading this, you must have obtained it, so congratulations, you have found one of the most obscure elder monsters. Sorry its not very useful in combat or anywhere else. Good luck in your journey collecting all of them:)
This sentient ball of red vapor contains its own aerosol digestive system of corrosive vapors. When caught in its grasp, its victims skin melts.

A small fish with bright blue eyes, they are happiest in water. However they are magical and can follow their masters by floating in air with limited trouble. They have a hard bony plate on their foreheat that they use to strike any threat they can\'t run away from, and are known to master magic at a young age. Though friendly, they do not seek out company, preferring to isolate. Very thin, they are known to seemingly disappear when travelling directly at or away from an observer.

EdgeFinn is a larger version of the Minnow with a serrated crest and fins, as well as small, razor-sharp teeth. unlike most fish, its eyes face forward to stalk its prey, like the carnivores on land. It is known for hunting its prey with persistence, and it can smell blood three miles distant.

A Cuddlerfish is shaped like a Cuttlefish but also loves cuddling. That\'s why typically they come in pairs. They separate infrequently, and when they do, both halves become very needy and inevitably float back together. They are the very picture of toxic codependence.

A silver Taurus, with a sapphire sphere at its base. Etched on the Sapphire Sphere is the water Symbol. When it attacks, the crest appears in the center of the Taurus, and water drips from it. When one is near, calmness and complacency echoes in the mind.

Slicefinn is a shark. A hammerhead shark whose front finn is sharpened steel. It has a sensor on either end of its fin, that is both an eye and an underwater nose. As a result it can \'smell\' blood in three dimensions underwater, for eight miles in any direction

The toxic codependency of the cuddlefish has reached its apex, and the two cuddlerfish have fused into a single Snugglerfish. The Snugglerfish couldn\'t be happier though, each half truly fulfilled in its connection with the other. Who am I to judge?
A green-Blue stone formed over the centuries under the ocean, that channels magical power. They are famous for ornamenting pirate queens.

The Aqua Elemental is a large aqua symbol that has six crystallized water droplets on each of its six points. Its incredible mastery of magic has attracted additional symbols, and it can cast magics of those elements as well, though it is still most comfortable casting water magic.

A blue dragon that lives under the sea. It has incredibly sensitive scales, which it uses to sense prey. Despite its massive girth, it is quick enough to keep itself well fed. Under the oceans, it only fears Krakens in deep water, alhough it will fight a Levithan only at great need. As the top of the underwater food chain, some grow lazy, and gather treasures from shipwrecks for their massive hoards.

A Leviathan is a giant sea monster that can shoot a very pressured stream of water at its enemies. It grew from a huge collection of Cuddlerfish that fused together. It haunts the oceans and is an unstoppable force below the waves.

Gleaming, and hewn from rock far beneath the ocean floor, a Sapphire is a bright blue stone that can serve as a channel for aquatic magic. It is highly prized for its shininess, though any treasure seeker that would wish to kill it should take heed. It is very dangerous when threatened, able to cast water magic, as well as having a near impregnatable carapace, and damaging the carapace would reduce the value of the stone.

A collection of Elementals, with a large Aqua elemental in the center with the five other elements represented as smaller elementals around the edge. When the Atronach wants to cast spells from other elements, it pulls that elemental into the center and channels its magic energy through both. It is known as having the strongest magical capacity of any monster, and can cast toe-to-toe with even the strongest archmagi.

The Tapple\'s parents were terrible at naming babies, so they asked the tapple what it would like to be called. It tried to say tadpole, but as it was a baby, it couldn\'t pronounce it properly. The name stuck. The tapple is blue-green and is very proud of its long double-finned tail. Its parents told it not to get too attached, but it did anyway

The hider relies on its thick shell to save it from any incoming attack. It is still quite agile while hidden in its shell, and will slam its shell on its enemies to attack. Its shell is camouflaged in the swamplands where it dwells to appear as a simple mossy stone.

The rainbow frog is a frog that is colored like a rainbow. It was nearly hunted to extinction by the leprechauns, but they gave up when they realized that it wasn\'t always sitting on a pot of gold. In fact, it never was. Poor dead rainbow Frogs... There is animosity between the Rainbow Frogs and the leprechauns to this day. Their skin is highly prized for its hallucinogenic properties, and it was nearly hunted to extinction, until it became poisonous as well.

The frogami likes nothing better than to sit and meditate. It has mystic powers, and can see glimpses of the future. Licking its back is supposed to bring bad luck, which makes me wonder why anyone would do it, because it\'s poisonous and causes hallucinations. And while you\'re hallucinating, there\'s an angry magic frog annoyed that you licked its back. Or is that the hallucination? Little known fact: it was cut out of Naruto because it was too cool for either Jyria or Naruto to learn from.

The snapper rams its horned shell and tail on its enemies to disorient them then snaps with its massive jaw to cripple whatever it can grab on to. It Hides in the water, and on land, to ambush its prey, which it must get in the first bite or so, as it is very slow.

The frogaudy is not only rainbow, it also sparkles. It found this fake diamond ring once, thought it was shiny and awesome, and its wardrobe has only gotten shinier since then. Now it has a golden hat and a monocole as well. Its super fancy and thinks that its \'posh\' but all the \'posh\' people think that its cheap.

The esotoads left arm is blue, and its right arm is green. With its left it has telekineic control over the water, with its right it has telekinetic control over the earth. It became too lazy to walk long ago, and now whenever it wants to go somewhere it will conjure a sphere of water to float in, or a mass of land to sit upon that it then guides to its destination.
A giant Dragon Tortoise, the Crusheller likes nothing better than to grab ships with its massive jaw and let loose. This works on things smaller and less sturdy than ships as well.
The Frogealer is a shifty frog whose slime has addictive hallucinogenic properties. When it comes into contact with anyone, friend or foe, a random effect is applied.

The Meititode is constantly in meditation. It shields itself in a sphere of mud to protect itself. It is rightly considered the master of the natural elements, and can cast all levels of the natural magics. However, it is vulnerable to the moral elements.

A small cloud that curves around like a snake. It has no mouth and a small blue diamond on its head, its body is covered by fog, and it is lighter than air. Despite being a cloud, it resembles... a sheep?
A towering cloud with a yellow wolfs head that has no compunction about gliding down and biting something with its thunderFang when annoyed

The stratus is a cloud with a somber sheeps head that is very depressed and cries all the time. This is why it rains often when this particular cloud is out. It is highly against convective slavery, and even calls itself a free-convective.
The nimbus basically looks like a floating turtle with glasses, except the shell is a cloud and the head is yellow with a lame curly loop for hair. Its glasses are black, how they float I don\'t know
The Nephol is a cloud dragon with a yellow head an claws and no wings because it can float. It breathes lightening at its enemies.

The Cumulostratus can spread itself thin and use the water droplets that make up its mass as a lens to focus the sun on the battlefield, increasing fire and solar damage. However, it cannot attack while this is going on. In appearance it is rather formless, drifting high.
The Nimbuloponderant is a greater turtle that can cast heavy rain on the battlefield. The effect is the same as rain except 1.3 times stronger and weather attacks are strengthened
The Thunderus is a lightening dragon that flies through the clouds. Its roar is frightening to behold

The Cirricumulus is less concerned with rain and more concerned with air currents. It can cast air funnel which increases the damage of air-based attacks for the duration of the battle. In appearance its a greater wolf with a very long tail that is often wrapped around itself.
A greater Ice dragon, made eniterly of frozen raindrops and hail, the Cumulonimbus is a master of weather magic and can summon hurricanes and blizzards at will

The Snoball is a ball of snow, and no one can tell quite whats inside, as many different young snow creatures stay in the ball of snow until a teenager. It has the passive ability melt, which lessens the other teams fire abilities after it is slain
The FauxIce is a timid ice fox with a white pelt. It often makes ice sculptures of itself to decoy enemies. It can only do this once per battle though.

The Princeguin is a young emperor penguin that has yet to prove its worth. In penguin society, blood means little, so though the Princeguin was born in the royal family, he still has work to do before being a contender for the throne.

The icebreaker is an ice demon with a staff that has a large snowflake on its crest. It casts cold magic, and is great at starting conversations with women, especilly at parties. It knows lots of good pick up lines and even more bad ones.
The freki is an ice wolf that has ice instead of fangs, its fur is white, and it is capable of using ice fang to freeze its foes, preserving their meat through the frigid winter.

The kinguin has distuinguished itself on the field of battle for the Emperorguin, and has been afforded territories as such. It has yellow plumage on its head that represents its crown, however it is nowhere near as robust as the Emperorguin\'s

The white limper is an ice zombie that weilds a sword of ice and for some odd reason holds a grudge against people wearing black clothing, cloaks in particular. It also holds a great aversion to black-feathered birds, especially scavengers.

the Ice witch is in the process of selling her soul to the cold gods of death. Her eyes have turned a cruel blue, and the frost has bitten her extremities white. She is no longer capable of human speech, and the cursed shawl with which she surrounds herself has a icy blue tinge to it. She attacks with a frozen sycamore staff with a cold blue stone at its center. She is well versed in ice magic and thrives in the cold.

The Beaorn is a great polar bear with silver plating chased blue. It is known for its speed and its bulk which it uses to overwhelm attackers. It is stronger when surrounded by Fauxice and Freki which it considers its children.

The Emperorguin is the unquestioned leader of the guins and has red and yellow plumage to symbolize its authority. It has a passive ability that icreases the damage done by all ice attacks for the attackers side.

The Iceking is one of the generals of the white army, and can move very quickly despite its monstrous size. It commands and controls lesser frozen undead to great effect and wears a thorny crown of black ice.

The Ice lich is the penultimate ice demon that has transformed itself into full lich form. As such, it is very hard to destroy, as it has forsaken life itself in exchange for the freeze. It can drain heat from an enemy, freezing even the most fiery souls.

The Deepfish is a small fish used to the echoes of the darkness. Its face is sunken, its scales are dark and ruddy, the spines of its fin are black, but the webbing is blue. It feeds at the bottom of the ocean where no light can penetrate, and is accustomed to pressures that would crush the common man
The inker is a baby giant squid (in other words, a squid) that squirts ink in the eyes of its enemies, lowering their accuracy
The Starish is called so because it is kinda like a star except its also a fish. Its entire back is one large gaping mouth, which it uses to latch on to unsuspecting prey in the depths

The jelly is a small translucent purple magical fish that is bell-shaped and floats around. It seems to have a different kind of consciousness and understanding. It is incredibly poisonous, and wraps its tail around its enemies to sting them

The Vasquid is a full-fledged giant squid that is the size of a house when under water and considerably smaller when over land. Its tentacles are very strong and hard and can break even the most resilient bones. The only way to survive this fish is to dodge it.
The Ninjastar is a starish that gained sharp blades on its arms. To attack it throws itself at its enemies.
This octopus learned magic from his octopus teacher and now patrols the depths, camouflaging itself as a rock or coral before it mentally attacks and debilitates its unsuspecting prey.
Hypnotically glowing all colors of the rainbow deep in the dark trenches, this colorful jelly catches smaller weaker fish in its tail and consumes them to power its spells.

Known for its size as much as its ferocity, when stirred to anger from the depths of the sea, this gigantic monster is much stronger than it looks, and can rip ships in half. It is often summoned by squidman casters as a right of passage, whether many survive this ritual is unknown.

Patterned in the shape of a skull, the Death starfish is a master of underwater necromancy, and summons the souls of lost sailors to do its bidding. Its bite is lethal, and it can attach itself and swallow smaller fish, its very large sharp teeth making up nearly half of its body. Its a huge space ship fan, but for copyright reasons always emphasizes the "Fish" of Death Starish, to make lawyers happy and to keep people from getting offended. He learned this from his friend the white power ranger.

A master of magic beneath the waves, an octocaster is incredibly magically potent, in some cases able to cast 8 spells at once.
